body.name: be quiet! Shadow Rock 3 White 190W TDP CPU Cooler | Intel-1700 1200 2066 1150 1151 1155 2011-3 Square ILM | AMD AM4 | Black | BK005
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 9 mins
features: POWERFUL COOLING: Delivers an impressive cooling performance of 190W TDP, facilitated by five 6mm high-performance nickel-plated copper heat pipes with HDT technology.
QUIET & EFFICIENT: Features a decoupled Shadow Wings 2 120mm PWM high-speed fan, emitting a mere 24.4dB(A) even at its peak speed.
MEMORY ACCESS: Asymmetrical build ensures unobstructed access to memory slots, topped with an elegant brushed aluminum bi-color surface for aesthetics.
FRIENDLY MOUNTING: Boasts an easily installable installation kit, allowing mounting from above for hassle-free setup.
German Design I German Engineering I German Quality I German Performance
body.description: Model : Shadow Rock 3 WhiteOverall dimensions without mounting material :121 x 130 x 163(mm)TDP (W): 190Socket compatibility AMD :AM4 / AM3(+)Socket compatibility Intel:1200 / 2066 / 1150 / 1151 / 1155 / 2011(-3) Square ILMFan model : 1x Shadow Wings2 120mm PWM high-speedDecoupled fan mounting ✓Overall noise level (dB(A)) @ 50/75/100% (rpm) 11.5 / 17.5 / 24.4

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 181 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Cooling power and design Impressive cooling power and elegant looks Shadow Rock 3 White provides impressive cooling of 190W TDP and is designed for those searching for high performance air cooling and a low noise level. The white heat sink with its extraordinary elegance stands out especially in systems employing lightly coloured themes. Silent Operation A high fin pitch and low air resistance ensure the best possible performance in combination with the chosen fan. The decoupled Shadow Wings 2 120mm PWM high-speed fan operates at only 24.4 dB(A) even at the maximum speed of 1,600 rpm. Asymmetrical construction The Shadow Rock 3 White can be installed on all popular motherboards and its asymmetrical construction saves a lot of space. The memory slots in front of the cooler will not be blocked.

Easy to use and install Heatpipe direct touch Thanks to Heatpipe Direct Touch (HDT) technology the heat from the CPU is absorbed directly by the five 6mm high-performance copper heat pipes. Convenient to handle The be quiet! Screwdriver included in the scope of delivery helps you install the cooler and the mounting kit on the motherboard easily from above.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple to install.
reviews.reviewText: I like the overall aesthetic, and the top cover gives it that clean look. The fan is silent, especially when it is set to PWM with a fan curve. It has plenty of RAM clearance especially for non low-profile RAM sticks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dead silent, great cooling.
reviews.reviewText: Have this mounted on a 10700 (non-k). Is that overkill? Not really. With power limits removed, that thing will suck down 150w+, and this cooler will handle it all day long. Even running back to back CB R20 runs I think it was hovering in the mid-70's.Once you start getting near this cooler rating of 190w and holding there, maybe your temps would be closer to low/mid-80's, but that's a LOT of heat and more than most CPU's people are buying put out (especially under normal use).Oh, and it's virtually silent even at full speed (~1,600rpm).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am extremely pleased with this heatsink / fan, I was in a pinch and had a water cooler suddenly fail. In a pinch I choose this cooler as a replacement. Not only does this cooler provide better temps than the previous, it was super easy to read the instructions and install. Totally would recommend .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silent operation, easy installation and great performance!
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic cooler! Extremely silent and efficient! It does not interfere with corsair veagence memory modules at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best white market cooler in the market for air cooling.
reviews.reviewText: Originally I had a Be Quiet Shadow Rock Slim that did well until I used it for longer periods of time. Putting that one on and off took a while. I then wanted a white cooler so I purchased the Vetroo V5 White CPU Air Cooler which is a good cooler just like the hyper 212 evo or other entry level coolers but for a 8 core cpu its just enough unless you work from home/stream/play games while the PC is on 16+ hours a day. This is why I purchased again a Be Quiet cooler because the last one worked and handled it but it wasn't white. The slim is now going to my test bench. This Shadow Rock 3 White is a great cooler that has not given me issues so far. The installation took me only 5 minutes to unbox and put on. It took me 30+ minutes with the Slim and Vetroo.TL;DRPros:-Quiet-low noise even in an air case-Simple to put on, took me 5 minutes-Included screwdriver that will help in the future-temps stay in high 40s and low 50s all day and 70-80s gaming all day/streaming (2700x OC'd)Cons:-the fan included is not white but that's not really an issue.-only 1 fan included for the price

reviews.reviewerName: Tiny Little Tech ShopTiny Little Tech Shop
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality CPU cooler in White
reviews.reviewText: Looks and functions great. beQuiet! is known for high quality products, and this is no exception. Extremely silent fan, and the massive heatsink keeps temps early in check. Also, for those curious it just barely fits in the NZXT h500 case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Cooler But . . .
reviews.reviewText: This cooler can keep most processors functioning at a prime temperature, but you may have to add another 120mm fan so your running a push/pull configuration., especially for the Intel 125 watt processors.Now to my big gripe. The unit is white. Be Quite makes white 120mm fans, BUT with this cooler they supply a 120mm BLACK fan! So if we're doing a push/pull configuration we have to go and buy 2 120mm white fans. Obviously we then have a 120mm black fan as extra, which realistically, won't go to waste, but why sell a white cooler with black fans - especially when you have identical white ones in your catalog.Come on, they may not understand the USA customer (it is a Austrian company) but this, to me, is self-evident!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install
reviews.reviewText: Ease of installation plus very good cooling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth it if you want a quality option that’s not Noctua
reviews.reviewText: It is very quiet, I did change the black fan for a white fan to match my build but other than that keeps my cpu at a cool 33 C on idle

Ryzen 3700x, usato saltuariamente per lavori gravosi a piena potenza, discretamente più efficare della dissipazione ryzen stock, se avete spazio nel case (controllate le misure prima di ordinarlo) e non volete mettere il raffreddamento a liquido lo trovo un ottimo compromesso.Se fate lavorare tutti i core al100 % non pensate che vi tenga la cpu a 50 gradi..se volete stare su queste temperature potete limitare l'assorbimento di corrente della cpu tramite il bios, insieme al dissipatore otterrete un gran risultato e poche perdite di prestazioni.Facile da montare.
Bueno, apenas hace ruido y es facil de montar. Eso si... Os aconsejo medir bien vuestra torre porque andan las cosas justas en algunas...

Bonito y facil de instalar pero el problema llega cuando el procesador "Ryzen 3700X" tiene esos típicos picos de subida de frecuencia y en pleno juego puedes llegar a ver que llega casi a los 70 grados durante un par de segundos, después vuelve a bajar pero entre picos y picos llega un momento que se queda siempre por encima de los 50 grados y con el ventilador girando al máximo, por lo que si tenemos en cuenta que esto se produce en pleno invierno no me quiero ni imaginar lo que podría suceder en verano.Mi conclusión es que que el ventilador que incorpora este disipador se queda muy escaso a la hora de evacuar el aire caliente que emite la torre de disipación.Con un Noctua NH-U14S bajo las mismas circustancias es muy raro verlo superar los 50 grados y los "típicos" picos de los Ryzen no sabes ni que están ahí por que no se inmuta sin embargo este Shadow Rock 3 se atraganta a la mínima.Soy consciente de que hay una clara diferencia de precio entre el Shadow Rock 3 y el Noctua que he mencionado pero, si simplemente este Be quiet incluyera un ventilador que alcanzara al menos las 1800rpm es bastante probable que su rendimiento mejorara considerablemente, pero teniendo en cuenta que a día de hoy este Shadow Rock 3 cuesta la friolera de 64,44€ y si le quieres añadir por tu cuenta un mejor ventilador te irías tranquilamente a los 80€ en total, cómprate directamente el Noctua por que ahorrarás tiempo y posiblemente dinero.PD: Mi caja es una be quiet silent base 802 con 6 ventiladores de 14cm, 3 en el frontal, 2 en la parte superior y el último en la parte de atrás.
